text:
Nausea is something that at least
half pregnant women will complain of.
So nausea will usually start between about
five and six weeks and is usually
at its worst around nine to ten weeks.
There's a lot of theories about
what causes morning sickness and it's
probably multifactorial and it's likely really
related to increase hormone like estrogen.
But it's also related to progesterone,
causes a lot of changes in the GI tract.
And so what she basically end up with is
sort of a slowing the motility of the GI tract
which obviously could contribute to nausea.
And if that whole system is slower, backed up,
then youâ€™re going to have foods staying
in one place for longer periods of time
which is going to effect satiety
